Environment settings for analysis in Map Viewer.

Specifies the area that will be used for analysis. By default, it will use the full extent.

Specifies the area that will be used for raster analysis tools and raster functions when Use a different processing extent for raster analysis is enabled. By default, it will use the display extent of the map.

Specifies whether to use a different processing extent for raster analysis tools and raster functions. When enabled, raster analysis will use the value set for the Raster analysis processing extent, which is set to use the display extent of the map by default. When disabled, all types of analysis will use the value set for the Analysis processing extent, which is set to use the full extent by default.

Specifies the coordinate system that will be used for analysis and the result layer.

Specifies the area that will be used for analysis.

Adjusts the extent of the output so it matches the cell alignment of the specified snap raster layer.

Specifies the cell size or resolution that will be used for analysis and to create the output raster layer.

If As specified is selected and the output spatial reference is different than the input spatial reference, the cell size value will not be reprojected.

Specifies a mask layer in which only the cells that fall within the mask area will be used for analysis.

Specifies how pixel values will be interpolated when the input and output rasters do not align.

Specifies the type of processor that will be used. The options are CPU, GPU, and Automatic. If Automatic is specified, the tool will define the processor type.

Specifies the number of raster processing service instances used during the tool run. Supported values include empty strings (the tool will determine the number of raster processing service instances to use), whole numbers (0 or positive integers), and percentages. Percentages must include a percent sign (%) following the percentage value.

Specifies whether a warning message will appear if the estimated number of credits surpasses the specified threshold (enabled) or whether the analysis will run without displaying a message regardless of the estimated credit consumption (not enabled). The analysis will still honor credit budgeting settings for the organization.

Specifies the threshold at which a warning message will appear based on the estimated credit consumption from running the analysis. The analysis can still be run if the estimate surpasses the threshold.

Specifies the number of image sections that will be processed before restarting worker processes to prevent potential failures in long-running processes. The default is 0.

Specifies the number of times the same worker process will be attempted when there is a failure during the processing of a particular job. The default is 0.

Specifies the transformation methods that can be used to project the data for analysis.

This environment currently only supports Raster Analysis tools and Raster Functions.
